bibl.title: Short Notes on 3rd-Century Ptolemaic Royal Formulae and Festivals.
bibl.note: 1. The parade of royal thrones in Ptolemy II's Grand Procession in Alexandria. - 2. A dedication to King Ptolemy II and Arsinoe Philadelphos in Thera [I.G. XII, 3, Suppl. 1387]. - 3. The Festival of the Theoi Adelphoi under Ptolemy II and III. - 4. The date and context of a Ptolemaic inscription from Tyre [S.E.G. LVI, 1880]. - 5. Arsinoe III, goddess and queen, in a statue base at Ptolemais, Cyrenaica [O.G.I.S. I, 33].
bibl.seg: Stefano G. Caneva, Short Notes on 3rd-Century Ptolemaic Royal Formulae and Festivals.
